result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Behm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample unless already provided.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

records.addlTxt:
2:29 PM in Room 301. Defendant Nicholas J. Behm appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach in court for Nicholas J. Behm.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. 21CF321, 21CM107, 22CF78. State recites agreement. Def. to plead to 22CF78 - Ct. 1 and Ct. 3. Joint recommendation, Ct. 1 wh. 3 years probation, costs, AODA and followthru, abs.sob., fulltime work, counseling. Ct. 3 - 30 days jail, costs. Ct. 2 to be DRI.   21CF321- Def. to plead to Ct. 1. Joint recommendation 18 months ic, 24 es, imp/stayed, consecutive, 3 years probation, cost. Ct. 2 to be DRI.   21CM107 Ct. 1 to be DRI. Attny Fehrenbach in agreement. Def. agrees with terms. Plea questionnaire reviewed. Def. pleads to 
22CF78 - Ct. 1 - Poss of THC, 2nd or sub, guilty; Ct. 3 - Poss of paraphernalia, guilty. 21CF321 - Ct. 1 - Poss of meth, guilty.
The Court grants State's motion to DRI Ct. 2 in 22CF78; Ct. 2 in 21CF321; and Ct. 1 in 21CM107. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. Attny Fehrenbach is satisfied. The Court finds that Def. understands and that pleas are freely and voluntarily given. The Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1 and Ct 3 in 22CF78 and Ct. 1 in 21CF321. Sentencing argument by State. Sentencing argument by Attny Fehrenbach. Def. has nothing to say. Remarks by the Court.   
The Court will abide by agreement, orders
 22CF78 - Ct. 1 - withheld sentence, 3 years probation, costs including DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, completion of AODA and follow thru with any recommendations, maintain absolute sobriety, maintain fulltime work 30/hours week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, participate in any counseling as deemed beneficial by agent. Ct. 3 - 30 days jail, Huber, costs including DNA surcharge.   
21CF321- Ct. 1 imposed/stayed 3 1/2 year prison (1 1/2 year ic, 2  year ext. supervision) consecutive to any other sentence already received, 3 years probation, costs only including DNA surcharge, same conditions of probation as 22CF78. 
Eligible for earned release and challenge incarceration programs. Firearm/voting rights. 
Credit: 22CF78 - 23 days to be applied to Ct. 3. 21CF321 - 61 days. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Post conviction rights. Costs on Ct. 3 on 22CF78 to be converted to civil judgment. All other costs to be paid during probation.

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM in Room 203. Defendant Nicholas J. Behm appeared by video, in custody at the Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach in court for Nicholas J. Behm.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. 21CF321 and 22CF78. Court reviews charges on both cases, reviews rights for preliminary hearing. Waiver of P.H. reviewed. Def. confirms he wants to waive P.H. in both cases. Attny Fehrenbach is satisfied with Def.'s understanding. The Court finds that Def. has waived P.H., finds probable cause on both cases. Informations filed. Attny Fehrenbach acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters pleas of not guilty to all charges. Court receives pleas of not guilty. Plea/sentencing to be scheduled. 21CM107 to also track as plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
of Right to Preliminary Hearing Form

01:15 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Nicholas J. Behm in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas J. Behm appeared by video means.  All parties and reporter by Zoom.  Court calls 22-CF-78, 21-CF-321 and 21-CM-107.  Warrants quashed on the 21 cases.  22-CF-78/Def. has copy of complaints.
